ARABIC: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَءَايَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: There is certainly a Sign in that yet most of them are not muminun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed in this is surely a sign, and most of them were not Muslims.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Surely in that there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily herein is a sign; but most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There is indeed a sign in that, but most of them do not have faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! In this is indeed a sign (or a proof), yet most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Surely, in that there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: In that there is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:67] Surely in that, drowning of Pharaoh and his folk, there is a sign, a lesson for those [generations] who would come after them; but most of them are not believers, in God. The only ones to believe were Āsiya — Pharaoh’s wife — Hizqīl, the believing man of Pharaoh’s family, and Maryam daughter of Nāmūsī, she who pointed out the bone remains of [the prophet] Joseph, peace be upon him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition, (yet most of them are not believers) most of them were not believers.
